byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: France appears poised to enact legislation that could grant authorities far broader spying capabilities with almost no judicial oversight; measure's urgency stems from Paris terrorist attacks in January 2015; new powers would allow intelligence services to glean potentially unlimited electronic data from cellphones and Internet.
lead_paragraph: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages.

headline.main: Lawmakers in France Move to Vastly Expand Surveillance
headline.print_headline: French Take Step to Vastly Widen Domestic Spying

snippet: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages.
